column71: Suppose that you are doing a 16S marker analysis of the gut microbial community from a non-model worm.  This worm has a unique digestive tract evolved for the breakdown of a specialized diet.  Discuss a sequencing strategy, a number of challenges you expect to face, and what kinds of additional resources are needed to help explore your data set.
column72: Suppose that you are using the Illumina platform to sequence total DNA from soil samples.  For this particular study, the soil samples come evenly distributed from two plot types on a single farm - one growing corn, the other dairy cow pasture. Discuss one or more approaches you would take to analyze the data, as well as your expected sensitivity and specificity to taxonomic and functional sequence identification. Include in your discussion the technical limitations of your analysis.
